dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.welcome: Welcome back! Here's what's happening with your business today.

tooltips.grossProfit: Total revenue minus cost of goods sold
tooltips.deliveryExpenses: Total expenses related to product delivery.
tooltips.totalCostPrice: The total amount of purchase prices for all products sold
tooltips.totalPurchasePrice: The total amount of purchase prices for all products sold
tooltips.deliveryFee: The sum of all delivery fees collected from sales.
tooltips.totalProductsSold: The total number of products sold (sum of all product quantities in all sales).

grossProfit.title: Gross Profit
grossProfit.description: Gross profit is calculated by subtracting the purchase price from the selling price for each product sold, then multiplying by the quantity sold.
grossProfit.formula: Formula: Œ£((Selling Price - Purchase Price) √ó Quantity Sold) for each product in each sale
grossProfit.example: Example: If you sell 5 units of a product that costs 1000 XAF and sells for 1500 XAF: Gross Profit = (1500 - 1000) √ó 5 = 2500 XAF

netProfit.title: Net Profit
netProfit.description: Net profit is the gross profit minus all business expenses.
netProfit.example: Example: If your gross profit is 100,000 XAF and total expenses are 30,000 XAF: Net Profit = 100,000 - 30,000 = 70,000 XAF

totalExpenses.title: Total Expenses
totalExpenses.description: The sum of all business expenses across all categories.
totalExpenses.formula: Formula: Œ£(Expense Amount) for all expenses
totalExpenses.includes: This includes all types of expenses such as: Delivery expenses, Utility bills, Rent, Other operational costs

totalSalesAmount.title: Total Sales Amount
totalSalesAmount.description: The total revenue from all sales, including any negotiated prices.
totalSalesAmount.formula: Formula: Œ£(Sale Amount) for each sale
totalSalesAmount.note: Note: If a product was sold at a negotiated price, that price is used instead of the standard selling price.

deliveryFee.title: Delivery Fee
deliveryFee.description: The sum of all delivery fees collected from sales.
deliveryFee.formula: Formula: Œ£(Delivery Fee) for each sale

bestSellingProducts.title: Best Selling Products
bestSellingProducts.description: Products are ranked by the total quantity sold.
bestSellingProducts.formula: For each product: Total Quantity = Œ£(Quantity Sold) across all sales, Total Sales = Œ£(Selling Price √ó Quantity Sold) across all sales
bestSellingProducts.note: Products are then sorted by total quantity in descending order.

totalPurchasePrice.title: Total Purchase Price
totalPurchasePrice.description: The total purchase price is the sum of the purchase prices of all products currently in stock. For each product, multiply the purchase price by the quantity in stock, then sum everything.
totalPurchasePrice.formula: Formula: Œ£(Purchase Price √ó Stock Quantity) for each product
totalPurchasePrice.example: Example: If you have 10 units of a product with a purchase price of 1000 XAF, and 5 units of another at 2000 XAF: Total Purchase Price = (10 √ó 1000) + (5 √ó 2000) = 10,000 + 10,000 = 20,000 XAF.

profit.title: Profit
profit.description: Profit is calculated as the total sales revenue minus the total purchase cost of sold products.
profit.formula: Formula: Total Sales Revenue - Total Purchase Cost of Sold Products
profit.example: Example: If you sold products for 50,000 XAF and their purchase cost was 30,000 XAF, then Profit = 50,000 - 30,000 = 20,000 XAF.

actions.restockHelp: Add new items. Ex: Enter '5' to add 5 units to the current stock.
actions.adjustmentHelp: Correct the total stock. Ex: Enter '8' if the new total is 8 units.
actions.stockAdjustmentNote: To update only the cost price without changing stock, enter the current stock value in the quantity field. The cost price and supplier information will be updated for the latest stock entry.

step1.title: Basic Information
step1.name: Product Name
step1.imageHelp: Add clear images to help identify this product. You can upload multiple images.
step1.referenceHelp: Auto-generated from name, but you can edit it.
step1.restockHelp: This value will be added to your current stock.
step1.sellingPriceHelp: Required: The price at which you sell this product.
step1.cataloguePriceHelp: Optional: Used for reference or promotions.

step2.title: Initial Stock & Supply
step2.stockCostPriceHelp: Cost price for this specific stock entry. This will be used for profit calculations.
step2.costPriceUpdateNote: Enter the cost price for this stock adjustment. This will update the product's cost price.

editTabs.infoBox: The product name and reference help you identify this item in your catalog. Categories help you organize products for easier filtering and reporting.
editTabs.stockInfoBox: Use this section to add or adjust stock. Restock increases available units, while adjustment is for correcting errors or losses.
editTabs.pricingInfoBox: Set the price at which you sell this product. The catalogue price is optional and can be used for reference or promotions.
editTabs.batchesInfoBox: Manage stock batches for this product. Each batch represents a specific quantity with its own cost price, allowing for accurate FIFO/LIFO inventory tracking.
